decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and mill effects while utilizing the graveyard with cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Thieves' Guild Enforcer. By controlling the pace of the game and limiting the opponent's resources, the player aims to outvalue and outmaneuver their opponent to secure victory. With a combination of creature aggression and spell-based control elements, this deck aims to grind out incremental advantages and eventually overwhelm the opponent through card advantage and graveyard synergy.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on using a wide range of removal spells and counterspells to control the board while gradually gaining card advantage with cards like Behold the Multiverse and Alrund's Epiphany. Utilizing Emergent Ultimatum allows for powerful late-game plays while Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra effects. The deck also ramps up with cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven to ensure it can cast its powerful spells consistently. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and card advantage.

This deck focuses on creating a fast-paced aggressive strategy by quickly playing powerful creatures like Elder Gargaroth, Goldspan Dragon, and Lovestruck Beast. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with quick creature drops and efficient removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and damage potential to the deck. The Great Henge provides additional card advantage and life gain, while cards like Mystical Dispute and Saw It Coming help maintain control over the game. The mana base is designed to support the various color requirements of the deck.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on creating a fast and powerful board presence by utilizing strong creatures such as Lovestruck Beast, Wicked Wolf, and Feasting Troll King. The deck also includes key cards like Embercleave for extra damage and The Great Henge for card advantage and life gain. With the ability to generate food tokens with Trail of Crumbs and Gilded Goose, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly while maintaining card advantage and resilience through cards like Scavenging Ooze and Elder Gargaroth. The overall strategy is to pressure the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, using powerful creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Goldspan Dragon to quickly pressure the opponent. It also includes cards like The Great Henge for additional value and Obosh as a companion to enhance damage output. The deck incorporates a mix of creatures, removal spells, and counterspells to control the board and protect its threats. By curving out with efficient creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to win the game by applying constant pressure and quickly overwhelming the opponent.

The main concept of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost, aggressive creatures like Fervent Champion and Robber of the Rich, while also taking advantage of Torbran, Thane of Red Fell to increase the damage output. The deck utilizes powerful equipment like Embercleave to further boost the damage dealt by creatures, along with direct damage spells like Frost Bite for removal. The mana base includes Snow-Covered Mountains for synergy with Frost Bite and Faceless Haven for additional creature threats.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control tools to slow down and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Emergent Ultimatum to eventually overpower them with powerful threats like Elder Gargaroth and Alrund's Epiphany. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value, while cards like Binding the Old Gods and Shadows' Verdict help deal with problematic permanents on the opponent's side of the field. The deck aims to grind out the opponent and generate incremental advantages until it can close out the game with its bigger spells and threats.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control tools to disrupt opponents while generating card advantage through cards like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Heartless Act and Shadows' Verdict while ramping into powerful threats such as Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Elder Gargaroth. The deck also includes Emergent Ultimatum to tutor for key cards and finish the game with powerful spells like Alrund's Epiphany. With a strong mana base and diverse array of threats and answers, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 setting.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent by playing a combination of efficient creatures and powerful instant/sorcery spells. By utilizing cards like Lovestruck Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, Goldspan Dragon, and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage and drawing cards. The deck also includes some counter-magic spells like Essence Scatter and Saw It Coming to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own threats. The mana base is built to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells on curve.

The key concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures. It focuses on playing efficient and powerful creatures like Goldspan Dragon, Questing Beast, and Lovestruck Beast, while also utilizing the versatility of cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Embercleave to deal damage. The deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence with cards such as Brushfire Elemental and Kazandu Mammoth, while generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper. It also includes some removal options like Fire Prophecy and Shatterskull Smashing to control the opponent's board and ensure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive offense using the Cycling mechanic to draw and play multiple cards per turn. By cycling cards like Flourishing Fox, Zenith Flare, and Startling Development, the player can quickly build a board presence and deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Valiant Rescuer and Improbable Alliance to create tokens for additional pressure. The mana base is optimized for smooth cycling of cards and ensuring the player has access to the right colors at all times.

The main concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creature cards like Anax, Hardened in the Forge and Robber of the Rich. The deck includes powerful support cards like Embercleave and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell to increase damage output. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game, using burn spells like Frost Bite and creature abilities to quickly lower the opponent's life total. The deck's mana base includes Faceless Haven and Snow-Covered Mountain to ensure consistency and maintain aggressive momentum.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. It aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing creatures like Torbran, Anax, and Rimrock Knight, as well as powerful equipment like Embercleave. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains and Faceless Haven provides additional versatility and resilience. The deck is designed to maintain pressure on the opponent while also having reach with direct damage spells like Frost Bite and Shatterskull Smashing. It prioritizes winning the game before the opponent can stabilize or gain control.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Bonecrusher Giant to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Lovestruck Beast and Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck can maintain card advantage while continuing to put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of counterspells like Saw It Coming and Disdainful Stroke help to protect the deck's threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful spells like Alrund's Epiphany and Shatterskull Smashing to help finish off the opponent or stabilize the board if needed.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and spells to put pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently. By playing aggressively with cards like Goldspan Dragon and Bonecrusher Giant, the deck aims to deal damage rapidly and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of card draw and counterspells helps to maintain momentum and protect the board state, while powerful cards like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and The Great Henge provide additional threats and advantages. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's powerful spells and creatures, ensuring a smooth and consistent gameplay experience.

The main idea of this deck is to use aggressive creatures like Kazandu Mammoth, Lovestruck Beast, and Goldspan Dragon to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes powerful spells like Alrund's Epiphany and The Great Henge to provide additional value and card advantage. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the deck's aggressive strategy by granting a damage bonus to all odd-costed creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creatures and impactful spells.

This deck focuses on generating card advantage and controlling the board through a combination of powerful creatures, removal spells, and counterspells. By utilizing the Companion mechanic with Yorion, Sky Nomad, players can consistently flicker their permanents for value. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany to close out games. With a mix of ramp spells, card draw, and versatile removal options, Sultai Control aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents in a grindy, attrition-based game plan.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing mill and graveyard manipulation to control the game. The key concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by constantly milling their deck, taking advantage of cards like Merfolk Windrobber and Ruin Crab. Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief also contribute to the mill strategy while providing additional aggression. The deck also includes various counterspells like Disdainful Stroke and Mystical Dispute to control the opponent's plays. Removal spells like Eliminate and Heartless Act help deal with threats, while Drown in the Loch provides flexible removal and counter options. Into the Story and Agadeem's Awakening serve as powerful card advantage and recursion tools.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and enchantments like Doom Foretold and Elspeth Conquers Death. It also utilizes the Yorion, Sky Nomad companion to create value by blinking permanents for additional triggers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and eventually closing out the game with powerful finishers like Emeria's Call and Archon of Sun's Grace. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells, focusing on quick and efficient damage output. By utilizing creatures like Kazandu Mammoth and Questing Beast, along with powerful equipment like Embercleave, the deck aims to quickly establish a threatening board presence. The inclusion of cards like Shatterskull Smashing and Fire Prophecy provide additional removal options to control the board. The deck also includes some card draw with Edgewall Innkeeper to help maintain momentum and fuel the aggression. This deck is all about fast and relentless aggression.

This deck focuses on utilizing cycling mechanics to quickly cycle through cards and draw into key pieces, while also providing aggressive threats on the board. By cycling through cards like Valiant Rescuer, Flourishing Fox, and Drannith Stinger, players can amass a large number of tokens and deal damage quickly. Zenith Flare serves as a powerful finisher, dealing damage based on the number of cards cycled that turn. This deck aims to apply pressure early and close out games with explosive burst damage.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing the red color's fast pace and direct damage spells. Torbran, Thane of Red Fell enhances all red creature's damage output, while Embercleave provides a significant boost to your creatures' power. The deck aims to control the board with efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Anax, Hardened in the Forge, while also closing out the game quickly with direct damage spells like Frost Bite. Faceless Haven provides a resilient threat that can finish off opponents if needed.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly bring out aggressive red creatures and use them to deal damage to the opponent as efficiently as possible. By utilizing powerful creatures like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Anax, Hardened in the Forge, as well as powerful equipment like Embercleave, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The use of snow-covered lands and frost bite spells adds additional versatility and utility to the deck, allowing for both aggressive plays and removal options.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive red creatures and utilizing cards that deal direct damage to your opponent. By combining powerful creatures like Torbran and Anax with efficient removal spells like Frost Bite, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and overwhelm them with fast, high-impact threats. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains allows for additional synergy with cards like Faceless Haven, providing the deck with additional threats that can close out games quickly. Overall, the strategy is to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to respond to your threats.

The main concept of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent's life total. It utilizes low-cost creatures such as Rimrock Knight, Fireblade Charger, and Fervent Champion to apply early pressure. The deck also includes powerful cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Anax, Hardened in the Forge to maximize damage output. Additionally, the deck features various burn spells like Frost Bite and Bonecrusher Giant's adventure ability to remove threats and finish off opponents. The inclusion of Embercleave further enhances the deck's ability to deal massive damage.

The key focus of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Phoenix of Ash, Rimrock Knight, Torbran, Thane of Red Fell, Bonecrusher Giant, Anax, Hardened in the Forge, Fireblade Charger, Fervent Champion, Robber of the Rich, as well as key spells like Embercleave and Frost Bite. The inclusion of Castle Embereth and Faceless Haven provides additional utility and Snow-Covered Mountains ensure that the deck can consistently produce the necessary resources for its aggressive gameplay.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on gaining control of the game through removal spells, counterspells, and powerful late-game threats. With the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad providing extra value, the deck aims to outvalue opponents with cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany. It also utilizes the mana ramp provided by cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven to cast big threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Kiora Bests the Sea God. The deck's versatile removal suite and card advantage engines give it the tools to handle a variety of threats and win the game through incremental advantage.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany to create powerful value plays and gain card advantage. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Heartless Act and Shadows' Verdict to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra benefits. With a mix of card draw, removal, and win conditions, this deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the game until it can win with its powerful late-game threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing various removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes powerful card draw and ramp spells to ensure consistency and access to key cards. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and synergy with the deck's strategy, while the diverse land base provides flexibility in mana fixing. The deck aims to out value the opponent with powerful threats like Vorinclex and Emergent Ultimatum, while maintaining control throughout the game.

The main focus of this Sultai Control deck is to control the board and outvalue your opponent through card advantage and powerful spells. The deck includes a variety of removal spells such as Heartless Act and Shadows' Verdict, along with powerful threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Elder Gargaroth. The deck also includes powerful card draw spells like Esika's Chariot and Sea Gate Restoration to help you maintain card advantage. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game and outlast your opponents with powerful threats and card advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes to handle threats from the opponent. It also utilizes powerful card draw spells and ramp spells to maintain card advantage and accelerate its mana base. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides extra value by blinking permanents for additional benefits. The key concept of this Sultai Control deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a variety of removal spells and counterspells. The deck focuses on a Sultai Control strategy, utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to control the game. The deck includes powerful threats such as Elder Gargaroth, Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider, and Valki, God of Lies, while also including cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany for late-game inevitability. With the addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck aims to generate value and out-value opponents over the course of a long game, while using a mana base that allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on establishing control over the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through various draw spells and card selection effects. By efficiently answering the opponent's threats and establishing a strong board presence with cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Emergent Ultimatum, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent in the late game. The mana base is built around the Sultai colors, providing a solid mana curve and flexibility in casting the deck's diverse array of spells.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and quick tempo plays. By utilizing cards like Edgewall Innkeeper for card draw and Goldspan Dragon for extra mana generation, the player can quickly establish board presence and apply pressure. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion allows for additional damage output. This deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and counter spells like Mystical Dispute while maintaining a strong offensive presence with efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Brazen Borrower.

The deck aims to utilize the companion Obosh, the Preypiercer to maximize damage output. This deck focuses on utilizing creatures with powerful abilities and a low mana curve to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. The deck also includes utility spells like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant to control the board and protect your creatures. The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and deal heavy damage to the opponent. It utilizes a mix of powerful creatures such as Kazandu Mammoth, Goldspan Dragon, and Lovestruck Beast, along with disruptive spells like Spikefield Hazard and Saw It Coming. The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, efficient white creatures while maintaining a strong board presence and protection for key cards. Utilizing cards that provide value when they enter the battlefield or protect other creatures, the deck aims to apply early pressure and create potential card advantage through the use of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion. By maximizing the use of snow-covered Plains and strategic combat maneuvers, this Aggro - Weenie White deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 setting.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a mix of removal spells, counter spells, and enchantments that disrupt the opponent's strategy. It utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value by flickering permanents for repeated effects. The main win condition is to outvalue the opponent with cards like Archon of Sun's Grace and Doom Foretold, while also disrupting their game plan with Extinction Event and Binding the Old Gods. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent colors for playing all spells efficiently.

This deck focuses on utilizing mill effects and disruption spells to control the opponent's resources and win condition. By consistently milling the opponent's deck with cards like Ruin Crab and Soaring Thought-Thief, and utilizing counterspells like Disdainful Stroke and Mystical Dispute, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recurring key cards from the graveyard, adding to the deck's longevity and control capabilities.

This deck is focused on controlling the game and disrupting the opponent's strategy. It uses a combination of creatures and spells to mill the opponent's deck and deny them resources. The key concept is to establish a strong defense while slowly diminishing the opponent's options and winning through attrition. The deck utilizes cards like Merfolk Windrobber, Ruin Crab, and Thieves' Guild Enforcer to mill the opponent's deck, while spells such as Drown in the Loch, Heartless Act, and Into the Story provide control and removal options. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using disruptive creatures and spells to hinder the opponent's strategy while setting up a win condition through milling. Key cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Ruin Crab, and Drown in the Loch help to disrupt the opponent's plans, while cards like Soaring Thought-Thief and Into the Story provide a win condition by milling the opponent's deck. The deck aims to control the game through counterspells and removal, while slowly milling the opponent out of cards.

The deck focuses on using mill and counterspells to control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan. By slowly milling the opponent's deck with cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, while also using cards like Drown in the Loch and Negate to counter key spells, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through attrition. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and resilience to the deck's control strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and enchantments. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Dance of the Manse and Treacherous Blessing. The deck is designed to stall the game with cards like Doom Foretold and Elspeth's Nightmare, while gaining incremental advantage with enchantments like Omen of the Sun and Archon of Sun's Grace. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a powerful companion, allowing for additional value through flickering permanents for extra ETB triggers.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a wide board of creatures and create card advantage. By efficiently cycling through cards and utilizing cards like Zenith Flare and Irencrag Pyromancer, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent and win the game as quickly as possible. The deck includes cards like Startling Development and Boon of the Wish-Giver to cycle through the deck while also providing additional benefits. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to be aggressive and utilize cycling to gain a strong advantage over the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a wide board presence with efficient creatures and then pump them up with various spells like Showdown of the Skalds and Felidar Retreat. The deck also aims to have a consistent mana base using the pathways and Fabled Passage. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds another layer of consistency to the deck, allowing for additional mana sources. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive plays and overwhelming the opponent with fast, powerful creatures.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and impactful spells. By utilizing cards like Brushfire Elemental, Bonecrusher Giant, and Lovestruck Beast, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on. Goldspan Dragon provides additional aggression and ramp potential, while cards like Kazuul's Fury and Run Amok allow for explosive damage output. Showdown of the Skalds provides card advantage and helps maintain momentum. The deck features a solid mana base with a mix of pathways and Fabled Passage for consistency.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By playing efficient creatures that can deal damage quickly, combined with burn spells and equipment that can deal extra damage, the goal is to defeat the opponent before they can stabilize the board. The inclusion of snow lands allows for access to additional burn options, while Faceless Haven provides a strong threat that can be activated at instant speed. This deck's strategy is to be fast and relentless in its assault, constantly applying pressure to the opponent.

The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains allows for the use of Frost Bite and Faceless Haven for additional removal and combat tricks, making it a formidable opponent in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.

Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast is used to cheat out powerful threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and Esika's Chariot. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Negate to protect its board and reach. The mana base is built around triomes and pathways to ensure consistent access to all three colors necessary for the deck's powerful cards.

The main concept of this deck is to establish board control early on with cheap and efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Brazen Borrower, and Lovestruck Beast, while also generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper. The deck aims to control the game with counterspells like Saw It Coming and Disdainful Stroke, and protect its threats with Shark Typhoon. The deck also has powerful finishers in Goldspan Dragon and Alrund's Epiphany to close out the game quickly. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency in casting spells of different colors.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and spells in the Temur colors (red, green, blue) to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent. It aims to establish board presence early with efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, while using spells like Alrund's Epiphany and Shatterskull Smashing to maintain control and pressure. The deck also includes versatile cards like Shark Typhoon and Brazen Borrower for additional flexibility in different matchups. The mana base is carefully constructed with a mix of pathways and triomes to ensure consistent access to all three colors.

The main idea behind this deck is to swarm the board with low-cost, aggressive creatures in order to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. By utilizing cards like Usher of the Fallen, Luminarch Aspirant, and Seasoned Hallowblade, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and maintain pressure. Additionally, cards like Skyclave Apparition and Archon of Emeria provide disruption to the opponent's game plan, allowing for a smooth path to victory. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of consistency and resilience to the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on flooding the battlefield with low-cost and efficient creatures in order to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards that provide protection and buffs to the creatures, as well as equipment that can turn them into significant threats, the strategy is to maintain a relentless offensive pressure. The inclusion of various gods and other powerful creatures adds versatility and resilience to the deck, making it capable of adapting to different situations while maintaining its aggressive game plan. The companion card Yorion provides additional value by allowing for repeated use of valuable enter-the-battlefield effects.
